Reviews.Title: “Great Price, looks lovely, no frills.”
Reviews.Author: Sunraven
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were of a nice size and looked lovely. The sheets were very thin, although it was warm enough to not matter at the time. The pillows were pretty flat, I guess that was a downside for me. I like a bit more head support. The rooms were always cleaned and we had fresh towels. The staff was very pleasant. If you are like us, were we spent pretty much 90% of our time outside our hotel and just came home to sleep at night, this was more than adequate for the price. The location was great too - easy enough to catch the metro for farther locations or within walking distance to everything else. It is a bit noisy at night, but I am not a light sleeper. Coming home exhausted from walking all day quickly puts one to sleep. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: tsubame
Reviews.Content: Convenient location just a block from Roma Termini. Only disappointment was hotel Wifi was not working during our stay. But the staff allowed us to use the counter's PC internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Near Termini”
Reviews.Author: DWBCalgary
Reviews.Content: This is an OK two star located two blocks from Termini so we found it good for making an early run to the airport. The rooms are pretty basic but OK and I think the place is overpriced but that could just be Rome? The Termini area around the hotel is pretty sketchy so a one-night-stand enroute to somewhere else is all you want!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel next to train station”
Reviews.Author: Odedamir
Reviews.Content: We landed in roma on our way to napoli and had to stay a night in roma. We chose this hotel because it is very close to the train station and goot good reviews - good call! We got there at 1 am and the check in was quick and easy. Room was very clean and we even got internet access for free. In the morning it took us 3 miutes to get to the train station. Overall i would stay there again for the proximity to train station and the room itself. However, If i was going for a romantic weekend for 2 then i would probably select something closer to centro storico.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the location & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ELimSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of 4 nights in a double room, 3 consecutive nights when we first landed in Rome, and another night after our return from other parts of Italy. It was easy to reach Hotel Andreina - we took a train from airport to the Roma termini station, crossed a street after we exited termini station, walked 2 minutes, saw a yellow coloured building & followed the hotel signage to reach the hotel's reception. There were several hotels located in the same building. We had no security/safety issues with the location although it was just a few minutes away from the termini station. There were restaurants and shops along the streets around the hotel building. We took 20 mins to stroll to the Colosseum (we could have taken the train but we saw a lot more by walking). Our room for the first 3 nights was located a floor down from the reception level. Room was not very big, but adequate for a couple. Room facilities were good - comfortable bed, clean toilet, a safe, a small TV and a working table. However, it was a little troublesome to get to this level as we would have to take a small lift in the hotel or the main lift outside the hotel. We had a room on the same floor as the reception area on our last night. Both rooms' layout were about the same, but we prefered our final night room as it was much more convenient to get to. The hotel is owned by Andreina herself. We met her in the afternoons and her three other staff in the mornings - they were the best hotel staff we met in our two weeks' visit in Italy. It was amazing to observe such great service attitude in a hotel with very high occupancy rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Boombamel
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The hotel is well located. The staff was friendly.Penelope was very helpful. She did her best to answer all of our questions. I will go back to this hotel the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wiriya
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking, we just expected the good location and the not-to-expensive kind of hotel. Once checking in, it was a wow! Hotel itself is chic and charm. Staff were friendly and helpful with tourist information.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommendable for a low budget hotel in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vitrifizierung
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for Rome definitely cheap! The personnel is very friendly and helpful (which is quite exceptional for Rome). Only minus point: As this is a very small hotel and not a lot of guests take breakfast there, they want to know the evening before which time exactly you want to have breakfast. 1 time we were 10 minutes late and the coffee was already quite cold. Anyhow, typically italian breakfast is served and I recommend to book the hotel without breakfast and get something at the close by train station. Which leads me to the next point: The location is fantastic for exploring Rome. It is literally only a 2 minute walk to the train station (Termini) from which one is connected to both metro lines and the airport. All attractions are in walking distance (except for the Vatican, which is 45 minute walk or 15 minutes by metro). However, the region around the central station is probably not the nicest area concerning restaurants and night life. The rooms are okay, small, but with very high ceilings. The bathroom was very old, but clean. It is very quiet (as long as one keeps the window closed). In summary a very good hotel in the heart of Rome to a fairly ok price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: dani_verastegui
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, the only downside for me was the location. It was great for us because we needed to be near the train station. However, there was alot of soliciting in this side of town and it was a little dirty for my taste. Once you are in the hotel itself you are surprised because its clean and the restrooms are lovely. The bed is comfortable and the service is nice. The staff is helpful! Like i said it worked for us cause we needed to be near the train station, but the location was the only downfall to this lovely little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: threepwood86
Reviews.Content: Location: Seconds away from the main Rome station, Termini. Due to this, at night there are some noises (garbage truck, bars, busses ). Nothing huge though...wont be heard if the window is closed. Not the best of neighbourhoods at night, but its quite safe. Room: Very clean, although a little small. Comfy beds. No AC though..when we asked we were told that AC's are not switched on (?) at this time of year. Wifi available free of charge, with reasonable speed. Service: Very good, we were helped with a smile. Although restaurant knowledge is lacking a little bit. All in all, good value for money especially for a couple of days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: LilyCan
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were looking for a clean, well located but yet inexpensive hotel to stay for our first three nights in Italy. We found the perfect place after many days of researches on TA. Here are the pros and cons to choose the Andreina: Pros - Room: we looooovveeedd our room, so European. We really slept well and matresses were comfy like to one I have at home. It was clean and refresh each day. We were especially pleased by the safe in the room to store our passport and computer. As more, there is AC in the room (it wasn’t a big deal for us since it was November but it might be for those staying in the summer month). -Location: located near the termini, the hotel is really easy to find. The location is practical if you need to use buses, subway, trains, airport ... Plus, you can easily walk around from there. We were two girls and never found the area to be sketchy. It’s just a big city. -Services: Prior to our arrival, I emailed them for informations and they responded quickly. Booking was easy. We enjoy the welcoming attitude of Andreina and Philippa (flexibility of breakfast, advice on buses, help with the Internet, speaking to us in french, etc.). -Breakfast: we didn’t think we would have breakfast included from previous posts but we did and it was just what we needed to start our day (pastry, slice bread and jam, coffee and juice). Cons (they are not that deal breakers but you should be aware of it) -It may be a bit noisy at nights like someone upstairs walking in heels during the night or music from a bar downstairs. However, both didn’t bother us since we were jetlagged. -Internet signal is not strong and after trying for a while, we just stop trying to go on the Internet. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Andreina hotel and would totally stay there again on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: AmandaS05
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andreina was a great place to stay, it was incredibly clean and well kept. The bathroom was quite large for European standards although the shower was small. The only drawbacks are that the wi-fi only works in the lobby and out of the 400 tv channels we could only find one in english, and it was BBC.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect more than a cheap, quiet place to sleep. As others have”
Reviews.Author: sgoldberg2
Reviews.Content: noted, the hotel is very hard to find, and it's in a dodgy neighborhood. But the bed was firm and the shower was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Owner, Clean Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sobie1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in May. Hotel Andreina is very convenient. It's steps away from Rome's main train terminal and the Metro. This is a great 'base camp' for the independent traveller. There are many restaurants, an amazing bakery and a grocery store in the area as well. The best part of our stay was the owner Andreina. She is very friendly, courteous and helpful. She lives there and looks after all the details herself. Pride of ownership is apparent in how clean and well run the hotel is. Rosalinda adds even more character. She is a tiny white dog that spends most of her day in the lobby waiting for a belly scratch. Our room was large, clean and had many amenities. There was a safe, free Wi-Fi and cable TV with English channels. The bathroom was small but had everything you needed and also very clean. Our shower head wasn't working very well so one day while we were out sight seeing it was replaced. Great hotel over all. If I were to return to Rome I would Stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam1986
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just behind Termini station which is in the centre of Rome. It is located on the fourth floor and there is an elevator. What I found the best of our stay in the Andreina hotel was the service. The staff was very friendly and provided us with all the necessary information. Also if you need information in advance, for example how to get to the hotel from the airport, they will reply your emails always within a day. The rooms are small, but comfortable and clean. Breakfast is not that special, if you want a good breakfast you better have breakfast somewhere else. Concluding, the service is great, the location is perfect only the rooms are a bit tiny.

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: stefano80
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel thanks to tripadvisor! I was immediately suprised by the beauty of the rooms. They are very nice and far from the standard hotel rooms. Also the bathroom was very nice. Absolutely clean. The location is perfect if you need to be closed to the station. Just a bit noisy, but that's normal in Rome. Good price!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JoeFriday
Reviews.Content: Not super fancy, not the Ritz-no breakfast- but cozy, very clean, great location near the Termini train station and priced right. 3rd fl in very old building using rickty elevator- but kind of unique and fun- area was safe and lots of restaurants nearby and transportation as well- We did pre-cruise and would stay here again. Staff very nice and spoke good English- rooms excepetionaly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way !”
Reviews.Author: Jojefine
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect and very convenient, as it is very close to Roma termini (50 mts metro and railway station). The owners & hotel staff was very kind and fluent in english. The rooms and public areas are beautifully decorated. I really found the hotel's decoration amazing. The bathroom of our room was extremely clean and wonderfull, and the shower was perfect. Also the bed was big, comfortable with a very good mattress. I really loved the owners' cute dog, who gave us the most warm "Welcome" upon arrival. Generally , the hotel is perfect for the price we paid (less than 55 euros per night without breakfast). I recommend the hotel for couples (as the decoration is sooo romantic) with limited budget, who want to vist the "eternal city" and remember their stay eternally!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and close to transportation.”
Reviews.Author: asturiasmujer_8
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly appreciated our stay and the Pension Andreina. Fortunately friends who had been there before gave us directions. If you come from Termini station go out the door with the McDonalds across the street. Cross that busy street and go left. At first street go right and at next street go right. The pension is midway down that block on the left hand side of the street. There are several in the building just look for the name. It is so easy to get around from this hotel. Everything was tidy and comfortable and we had a triple as our adult daughter was travelling with us and we still had plenty of space. The hosts were kind enough to let us leave our luggage on our check out day so we could look around Rome for a few more hours. We were very satisfied with our stay here. And in pricey Rome it was a great value to us! When you shut your windows there was absolutely no street noise despite this being a busy area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, convenient lodging”
Reviews.Author: deeendub
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in Rome for only two nights before flying back to the US. We found this hotel on trip advisor and booked because of the price (Rome is EXPENSIVE) and the convenient location. Accordingly, we weren't expecting much so we were pleasantly surprised by the charm of the rooms (beautiful high beamed ceilings, sturdy furniture, tile floors) and extremely kind staff. Many people find the Termini area to be dodgy, but it's not bad... the convenience of the METRO system and train station makes up for the lack of picturesque views. This area is the ONLY place in Rome where the two lines of the METRO meet which makes quick travel to Rome's sights extremely easy. One last note: this hotel is on the 4th floor of a building housing other hotels on each floor - when looking for the hotel be sure to look for the small sign and then hike up the stairs or take the small lift.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a romantic break”
Reviews.Author: HAGGIS21
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at Andriena for our silver annieversary & thoroughly enjoyed it. Rooms were very rustic with high bemed ceilings & large windows with louvered doors. Very clean & clean towels every day. Very close to Termini Station where you can get the Metro to all attractions. Also all open top buses stopped at Termini. Lots of good Tratatorrias near by. One thing about Rome is it is not cheap. Was well warned about pick pockets & muggers but felt very safe (THE ONLY MUGGERS WE SAW WAS AT THE COLLESEUM WHERE A PHOTO ON YOUR OWN CAMERA WITH A DRESSED UP GLADIATOR COST 20 EUROS) so beware when they ask you for a picture.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: hoinar_ro
Reviews.Content: The most important characteristic - very clean. Also, the hotel in situated near Termini Station which is not pleasant but convenient. Rooms are rather small (we had a triple), without refrigerator but with TV, air condition...They clean the room on daily base which is very important. Good choice for those who don't spend so much time in the hotel but wants to sleep in a clean and pleasant room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and conviniently located”
Reviews.Author: SouvenirBrussels
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location if you want to be close to the main railway station "Termini". The area might not the nicest, but not so bad either. Hotel a bit tricky to find. It is located in a big old building with different hotels on each floor. Yes, sounds a bit shady but it isn't. Hotel building felt very clean and well taken care of. The hotel itself is very small, you enter into a mini reception desk and a little breakfast room. Then they have a funny elevator that will take you to different floors. Our room was a nice size (3 beds) with a small but fresh bathroom. Bed with very comfortable mattress. No noice. People working there were very friendly. Their English wasn't excellent but they really made an effort. Metro at the railway station makes it easy to travel around in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but area is shady”
Reviews.Author: roofies
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit hard to find but the workers in the surrounding bussinesses were very helpful with directions. The hotel is conviently located about 3 blocks from Termini Station, however, this area is very shady at night. Women may want to keep that in mind when booking this hotel. When you reach the building, you take the elevator up to the 4th floor and some rooms, you may have to take an additional elevator to a "middle" floor". This made me nervous because no one pointed out an emergency exit. Our room and bathroom was very clean. There was a huge closet and a TV. The AC is operated by a remote, however, the air conditioner failed to stay on continously. Im not sure what actually controls it but during the summer in Rome, the lack of an air conditioner is brutal. The female who works here is very knowledgeble, she usually works here in the morning and throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Iffy Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: AnniversaryinItaly
Reviews.Content: We were in the Andreina only one night before flying out of Rome. The location is exceptionally convenient, within very quick walking distance to the Termini Station (if you can haul your luggage through an aiport, you can make it to the Andreina without a cab). It's a little hard to find, watch the street numbers. You have to drag your stuff up a short (4 steps) flight of stairs and then take a tiny elevator up. Reception is nice and friendly. They have ANOTHER private elevator you take to some of the rooms. Our window overlooked the main street entrance, which is the biggest downfall of Andreina. There is a major tram stop right outside, so the area is crowded with people waiting around for the tram. While there were some shady looking folks, we never had any issues at all (again, just one day). No breakfast was included, not even coffee, but that was fine, there are a million places to eat. The room itself was clean, shower worked fine, tv worked fine, and the newer windows kept out the sound from the street. I definitely recommend the Termini area as it is great to be able to walk to where you want to go and then catch the easy bus/metro back to your hotel area. Plus easy to/from airport and to/from anywhere (vatican, villa borghese). The Andreina was about the lowest price I could find (we paid $120 euro). So if that is your main concern, the place is great. If you can afford a little more try 66 Imperial Inn. A much better Termini location but an extra $25 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, property, and staff; convenient (albeit shady) location”
Reviews.Author: Kris_K_D
Reviews.Content: Found the Hotel Andreina after extensive research for affordable lodging in Rome. The hotel (or pensione) is situated in a multi-story building of other pensiones and private residences. The reception/entrance is on the 4th floor and you take 5 flights of stairs or you ride in a small elevator (retro-fit) that holds up to 3 people. Hotel Andreina is very clean and is quaintly decorated, with lovely blue doors and hand-painted room numbers. The staff is hospitable and helpful, and their dog, Cin Cin, was well-behaved and sweet. Our room (#32) was one floor below, so we took their private in-house elevator down to the third floor. The room was decent-sized with a lovely bathroom, armoire, a spare twin bed, and sound-deadening windows that looked out onto Via Giovanni Amendola and the metro stop below (a popular stop it seems). The room's ceilings are high, making the room feel more spacious. Amenities were plentiful and re-stocked daily. There were even two pair of disposable slippers -- they were paper-thin (literally) and our toes poked through after a short time of wear, but the thought was nice. After our arrival, a small plate a fruit was left for us, along with a welcome note -- another pleasant, unexpected gesture. Hotel Andreina's location is at once an asset and a downfall. On one hand, it's close to the Termini train station (aka, convenient). On the other hand, it's close to the Termini train station (a less-than desirable neighborhood). We even witnessed a fight and the ensuing police activity from our room window. The location is seemingly better during the day, but quickly turns questionable at night. I would recommend Hotel Andreina for the independent budget traveler who would like to experience a family-run pensione.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Andreina
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giovanni Amendola 77, 00185 Rome, Italy
